title: structuredContent missing from tool results in _execute_tool
body:
When running evaluations locally, `find_reward()` can't parse the reward because `structuredContent` is always `None`. The tool returns it but `_execute_tool` drops it when building `MCPToolResult`.

Reproducible with any scenario that uses `structuredContent` for grading. The evaluate tool returns `{"reward": 0.85}` as structured content but `find_reward` sees `None`.

I think `_execute_tool` in `environment.py` is constructing the `MCPToolResult` without passing through `structuredContent` from the underlying result.

comments_data.body: This might be related to the reward pipeline issue tracked in Linear (ENG-305). We're also seeing `--full` not working correctly and remote evals silently failing.
